page.title: 06Housing in Bristol
page.content: The rooms sometimes have a ceiling rose which is a circle of patterned plaster going around the light. They also have a cornice which goes around the top of the ceiling and has the same pattern as the ceiling rose. In every room the houses have fireplaces even in the bedrooms. Above the fireplaces there is usually a mantlepiece made of marble and it can hold quite a lot. Sometimes the fireplaces are tiled. The bathroom is usually not that big. The houses have quite big kitchens and the kitchen range would now have been replaced by a gas or electric cooker. The houses have cellars for the coal. They are usually 2 or 3 storeys high and have lots of chimneys.
